titleproper.value: Guide to the Harry Stein Photographs  <lb/>  1919-1922 <lb/> <num>PR 399</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-07-30T17:46:53</date>

abstract.value: This collection consists of 106 nitrate negatives taken by amateur photographer Harry Stein (1891-1964).  These snapshots were taken in and around New York City between 1919 and 1922. They include portraits, scenic views and street scenes.

p.value:
Open to qualified researchers by appointment only.
 
Advance notice is required to access these negatives. They are on possibly unstable, nitrate base film and have been transferred to cold storage in the N-YHS Conservation Lab.
Credit line should read: Gift of Andrew Stein in memory of Harry Stein
*This biographical note is based on information provided by the donor.
These negatives are on possibly unstable, nitrate base film and have been transferred to cold storage in the N-YHS Conservation Lab.

subject.value: Parks -- New York (State) -- New York   -- Photographs
Street photography -- New York (State)  -- New York.
